direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods return an inverse view of the map, but inverseOrderedBidiMap ensures the inverse map is also unmodifiable.
Both methods manipulate the map's entries, with entrySet returning the set of entries and inverseOrderedBidiMap returning the inverse map.
Both methods access the map's keys, with keySet returning the set of keys and inverseOrderedBidiMap returning the inverse map.
Both methods access the map's values, with values returning the set of values and inverseOrderedBidiMap returning the inverse map.
Both methods involve creating an iterator or a view of the map, with mapIterator providing an iterator and inverseOrderedBidiMap providing an inverse view.
Both methods involve creating an unmodifiable view of a map, with unmodifiableOrderedBidiMap creating an unmodifiable map and inverseOrderedBidiMap creating an unmodifiable inverse map.
